listings.description:
Want to be part of our mission to create the best developer tools for building blockchain applications?

Upvest´s mission is to provide developers with the best tools to build on top of Bitcoin, Ethereum and other major blockchain protocols. We enable developers to focus on their application, not the infrastructure. Taking care of the security, blockchain communication, and legal compliance, providing developers with a simple API and convenient SDKs to build applications underpinned by the latest blockchain technologies.

Founded by serial entrepreneurs [Jesper Noehr]( founder of Bitbucket, exit to Atlassian and [Martin Kassing]( , COO of ShopCo, exit to Klarna, Upvest has generated substantial early stage revenues and is backed by Europe’s largest VCs (e.g. Holtzbrinck Ventures) as well as international investors (to be announced).

We are a hungry bunch of +22 people. Around 75% of our company is composed of engineers and we are proud to single out our strong Engineering culture . With entering Series A, we have enough fuel to create the best developer experience to build blockchain applications.

Your Mission
  • Be part of creating the best developer experience to build blockchain applications
  • Develop and design of API´s to enable companies to integrate blockchain key management and services to their end-users
  • Develop API’s for live blockchain data, delivered via webhooks, enabling companies and individual developers to build applications that rely on blockchain events and data
  • Build microservice architecture
  • Develop data processing and storing mechanisms
  • Do 75% development and approx. 25% maintenance. As we test everything during development, the need for maintenance is smaller than usual.
  • Reporting directly with our VP Engineering and CTO

Your Profile
  • Your are pro-active in learning and have a high sense of taking ownership
  • You contribute creative problem solving, improve code & process, and generally leave things better than you found them
  • You care about good quality code, reliability, really caring about the product
  • You like to go to meetups and conferences, serving as an evangelist for our mission, having a personal interest in the blockchain space.
  • You are willing to share knowledge and best practices with others, both inside and outside Upvest

Proven Experience In
  • API development for end users and 3rd party integrations
  • Python
  • Django and the Django REST framework
  • PostgreSQL
  • NoSQL databases
  • Github
  • CircleCI
  • At least one programming paradigm next to OOP
  • Writing documentation

Experience In These Fields As a Big Plus
  • Strong knowledge in one of these languages: Scala, Go, JS/Node.js, C
  • OpenAPI/Swagger
  • Prometheus or TICK stack (Telegraf, InfluxDB, Chronograph, Kapacitor)
  • Google Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform
  • Prior experience in working with API-based products
  • A practical understanding of cryptography
  • Personal contributions to any kind of open source projects (we deeply believe in the power of open-source)

Technologies We Use
  • Python / Scala (legacy) / Go (exploring) / C
  • TypeScript / JavaScript (ES6) / React
  • Google Cloud Platform / Kubernetes / Istio / Docker / CircleCI
For more insights, check our Tech-FAQ

Your Team

Around 75% of our company is composed of engineers and we are proud to single out our strong Engineering culture.
  • We believe in a rewarding collaboration ahead of egos
  • Agility ahead of the process
  • Autonomy ahead of micro-management
  • And customer requirements ahead of presumptions
We’re an English-speaking tech team. Most people suit the role of multi-disciplinary. We either work individually or in small groups, taking features from start to finish. With flat hierarchies, everyone responds to the VP of Engineering. Our structure is fairly loose and delivery-oriented.

Our Core Values
  • Never give up Go the extra mile, grow yourself and others to create value
  • Be honest With others, and with yourself. Cut the bullshit, know where you have room for improvement, and be kind
  • Be a community player Do things that help others without a direct benefit
  • Leave it better than you found it Always strive to improve things, don't accept mediocrity

Our Offer
  • Work in a key role at one of Europe’s fastest growing Blockchain-tech companies
  • Be part of a cutting-edge blockchain engineering culture
  • Well-funded venture with top international investors
  • Competitive salary and employee equity
  • Highly dynamic, friendly environment that allows for independent work
  • Open and transparent company culture
  • Education budget for conferences, training and certifications
  • Numerous perks and team events like hackathons and team off-sites
  • nice office in the center of Berlin next to Hackescher Markt
Attractive relocation package:
  • Full VISA sponsorship for you and your loved ones
  • Paid international arrivals
  • Help with apartment search
  • And anything else we can do to guarantee your smooth arrival to awesome Berlin
Interested?

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

The position is available immediately and offers an undated contract. Company offices are located in in the heart of Berlin (Mitte), Germany.

Upvest is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applicants from any national origin, sex, sexual orientation, religious background, gender identity and those individuals with disabilities to apply.

Who checks all the boxes?! We believe in people with a great attitude and the desire to evolve constantly to make things happen nobody has done before.

If you are excited to get in touch, we are happy to get to know you and tell you more about us and our mission!

Or feel free to contact us directly - at Upvest our tech recruitment is done by tech people:

Florian Feichtinger, Developer Evangelist

listings.position: Software Developer (front-end, back-end or full stack)
listings.description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

CONNECTING PROFESSIONALS
Yacht is specialized in connecting highly trained and experienced professionals with organizations, through recruitment and secondment. Yacht is part of Randstad, a global leader in recruitment and human resource solutions, founded in the Netherlands in 1960. Together we are active in over 40 countries and providing employment opportunities for more than 29,000 people.

CHALLENGING PROJECTS AND JOBS
We offer challenging projects and jobs at innovative startups and multinationals in Information Technology, Finance and Engineering, such as Siemens, ASML(LINK) and Philips (LINK). We are the driving force behind the careers of hundreds of professionals. Both our clients and candidates value our in-depth knowledge of the client market.

GET TO KNOW YOU
Beyond the basic skill requirements and your educational background, we’re interested in knowing you as a person. What drives you? What is your definition of success? Before introducing you to our clients, we will take your goals and preferences into account, out of respect for the organization ánd you.
Functieomschrijving

Join the leading companies in IT
Are you looking for a new challenge? Have you ever thought about the Netherlands as your next career destination? Come to one of the most innovative countries in the world, where you will experience a great living and working environment. Join our developers team at Yacht and be part of our Most Dev community.

Most Dev community
Most Dev is the Yacht Community by and for developers and data professionals. We are constantly looking for the most challenging positions at our clients, so that you can work on meaningful and technically advanced projects. We invest in improving your skills through a tailor made education program. At our Yacht Academy you will be offered various possibilities to gain and share knowledge through training, workshops and tech talks. And we organize events such as hackathons, VR zombie shootings (which is quite fun actually) and bbq’s, to chill out and have a good time together.

Want to know more? Watch this video about the Most Dev community: https://youtu.be/VttLo1rjhCM

Yacht is one of the leading HR companies in the Netherlands. We focus on development positions for front-end, back-end and full stack developers, as well as data scientists and data engineers. Amongst our clients are ING, ABN AMRO, Rabobank (the 3 largest banks in the Netherlands), eBay, VodafoneZiggo, Philips and many more interesting tech companies.

About You

You are completely king or queen in software development. Whether you are focussed on Java or Javascript, know everything about Angular or React or are master in data engineering - you are always looking to improve yourself. Whether you call yourself front-end, back-end and full stack developer, your knowledge is up-to-date, you like working in Agile/Scrum environments and are willing to share your experience with others.

Working in the Netherlands
When you have decided that Yacht is going to be your next employer, we are going to help you relocate. We have a special department to support you: the Expat Center. They will take care of applying for your visa, help you find housing and book your flight. We will even pay for your flight, your first month of rent and for the visa application. That is how we ensure that your arrival in the Netherlands goes as smoothly as possible.

What does that look like? Watch this video: https://youtu.be/U_UzTZMuDu0
Functie-eisen

This Is What We Expect From You
  • Degree in Computer Science / IT
  • 5+ years of experience in development
  • Professional experience with the newest technologies
  • Experience with cloud and/or DevOps solutions
  • Speaking English fluently and having great communication skills
  • Being flexible in working for different clients
Arbeidsvoorwaarden

What do you get in return?
  • One of the coolest communities to work with
  • A salary, depending on your work experience, ranging from € 3.200,- to € 5.000,-
  • Your own budget for education purposes
  • A single person who guides you
  • Help with relocating and applying for visa
Interested in joining us? Send your resume and motivation to Pieter Landsman via Pieter.landsman@yacht.nl or call him on +31 (0) 6 45 95 57 40
Sollicitatieprocedure

Voor meer informatie neem je contact op met Pieter Landsman via telefoonnummer 06-45955740

Werken voor Yacht
Yacht is dé organisatie van en voor professionals. Wij verbinden professionals en organisaties die het verschil willen maken. Ons doel is optimaal resultaat: jou als professional uitdagend werk bieden waarmee jij de organisaties van onze opdrachtgevers blijvend verbetert. Behoor jij tot de beste professionals in jouw vak? Wil je samen met vakgenoten het verschil maken bij toonaangevende organisaties? Dan willen we jou graag leren kennen.

Are you a self-starter who loves problem solving, working with people and making a difference to health research? Do you get really excited by BIG data, innovative engineering, data analysis, data visualisation and applied ML/AI? Do you have a background working with health data? Do you want to fast track your academic career working across several high impact projects with many opportunities for publication? If so, then this could be the role for you!

We are recruiting for a Health Data Scientist. You will be working within the Health Informatics Centre (HIC - at the University of Dundee working across several research projects. You will work within the academic arm of HIC and be supported by the team of ~35 experts within HIC. HIC have grown year on year for the past 5 years and continue to grow with significant recent success in grant awards. We have supported over £180M of research projects in the past 5 years.

We are a fun team who pride ourselves on improving our software and solutions. We try to keep pace with industry and technological advancements and train our staff accordingly.

Your Priorities Will Include
  • Applying your data science skills across a range of research projects, supporting the academic outputs from the work of the whole HIC team.
  • Contributing specialist health data domain knowledge to the software development team.
  • Developing and training AI algorithms.
  • Publishing our findings in relevant journals and presenting at conferences.
  • Promoting our research on the safe, secure and anonymised use of patient data to the general public.

Who We’re Looking For
  • A PhD in relevant subject or equivalent experience.
  • Ideally several years’ experience in data analysis/software development/algorithm development.
  • An academic publishing record and interest in further publication
  • A desire to apply specialist expertise in support of fellow researchers in other fields.
  • Skilled at engaging and influencing a range of internal and external stakeholders to work together to tackle problems and identify and deliver effective solutions.
  • Excellent interpersonal, listening and communications skills, both verbal and written.

What we can offer
  • A competitive salary package in the range of £32,817- £49,553 based on skills and experience.
  • An initial appointment for 2 years with the possibility of extension
  • Visa sponsorship if required.
  • The opportunity to advance your research career with publication in high-coefficient journals.
  • An excellent work – life balance and working environment. A range of personal and professional development courses, training opportunities, 39 days annual leave per year and are supported by a range of Work Life Balance policies, staff support networks, membership of Athena SWAN and Stonewall and a full range of disability services which all create an enjoyable and inclusive place to work. It is the diversity of our staff and students that make the University of Dundee an enjoyable place to work.
Appointment as a Postdoctoral Research Assistant on the Grade 7 salary scale is dependent upon you having been awarded a PhD. An appointment may be considered if you are shortly expected to be awarded a PhD. The initial appointment would be made as a Research Assistant on the Training Grade 7 salary scale (Spinal Point 25 - 28 £29,176 - £31,866).

The closing date for applications is 04 November 2019

For further information about this position please contact Professor Emily Jefferson ( click apply ). For more about HIC please visit .

Role Summary

You will be responsible for designing and programming a small module or a large component and designing a feature, set of features, or whole feature area. She/he will work independently and contribute to the immediate team and to other teams across business. She/he will Lead design discussion in a limited manner.

In This Role, You Will

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Work on the Predix Insights Platform engineering team responsible for developing and managing the Predix platform big data and streaming IIoT analytic platform
  • Develop high performance, low latency, robust, reliable, scalable and innovative IIOT applications and platform services
  • Support a 24/7 live production environments on a rotational basis
  • Debug, troubleshoot, and improve live cloud-based system
  • Work with customers to address their concerns and issues
  • Apply principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing Techniques
  • Writes codes that meets standards and delivers desired functionality using the technology selected for the project
  • Build features such as web services and Queries on existing tables
  • Understand performance parameters and assess application performance
  • Work on core data structures and algorithms and implement them using language of choice
  • Drive increased efficiency across the teams, eliminating duplication, leveraging product and technology reuse
  • Translate requirements / vision into prioritized list of user stories and deliver to required timelines and quality standards
  • Proactively share information across the team, to the right audience with the appropriate level of detail and timeliness

    Qualifications/Requirements

    Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math). A minimum 6 years of professional experience.

    Eligibility Requirements:
  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.
  • Must be willing to work out of an office located in San Ramon, CA

    Technical Expertise

    Desired Characteristics:
    • Knowledge of cloud and distributed systems
    • Hands-on experience in Go/Java programming language
    • Experience with AWS (EC2, S3, EFS, EMR)
    • Experience with Spark, analytic runtimes, big data, Kafka.
    • Experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a plus
    • Knowledge of Splunk is a plus
    • Experience with complex systems deployment on cloud
    • Experience with debugging and troubleshooting of complex systems
    • Experience with Unix / Linux based programming
    • Demonstrates the initiative to explore alternate technology and approaches to solving problems
    • Skilled in breaking down problems, documenting problem statements and estimating efforts
    • Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


    Business Acumen
    • Strong problem solving abilities and capable of articulating specific technical topics or assignments
    • Experience in building scalable and highly available distributed systems
    • Expert in breaking down problems and estimate time for development tasks
    • Evangelizes how our technology solves customer problems from a technology and business perspective
    • Excellent presentation skills
    • Good at customer interaction (willing to travel onsite)
    • Multitasking (work on quick and effective shot-duration projects)
    • Good at problem solving and working independently.
    • Attention to detail and thorough. Follows “Accurate on the first attempt” approach. Zero rework!


    Leadership
    • Demonstrates clarity of thinking to work through limited information and vague problem definitions
    • Influences through others; builds direct and "behind the scenes" support for ideas
    • Proactively identifies and removes project obstacles or barriers on behalf of the team
    • Shares knowledge, power, and credit, establishing trust, credibility, and goodwill


    Personal Attributes
    • Able to work under minimal supervision
    • Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface with senior leadership with confidence and clarity
    • Able to work well with global teams, including time-zone flexibility
    • Skilled in providing oversight and mentoring team members. Shows ability to effectively delegate work

      About Us

      GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com
      GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.
      Additional Eligibility Qualifications:GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).Additional Locations:United States;California;San Ramon;

THE ROLE


As a Senior Data Engineer you will work closely with the Data Science and Analytic team. The following tasks would be within your responsibility:

  • Building real-time data pipelines
  • Work closely with the Data & Analytic team to find innovative ways to leverage the data
  • Developing the Big Data platform
  • Evaluate State of Art technologies and how they can improve the processes

 

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE


  • Strong skills with Big Data Tools like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Flink, Elasticsearch
  • Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Hive, etc)
  • Exquisite programming skills in Python or Scala
  • Proven track record with the processing of large amounts of data sets
  • Experience with building data pipelines on Cloud (AWS or GCP)
  • Experience implementing machine learning 

 

BENEFITS


  • Monthly team activities
  • Open culture where they see mistakes as part of the learning process
  • Great office environment
  • Flexible working hours
  • Visa relocation

HelloFresh

At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe’s vibrant tech hub Berlin, we’ve become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.

We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 10 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London and Amsterdam. Our more than 4,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged.

Our Engineering, Data, Product and Security teams are located in Berlin and New York and are critical to what we do. From procurement tools, to conversion rate optimization, live pricing tools, payment services and add-on upselling features, we work on challenging problems and have a high output of building and releasing features and engines that make our business thrive and deliver real financial impact.

You can get a taste of what we've been working on by checking out our tech blog.

About The Job
  • You will work closely with Product Owners, UX, Data Science, Analytics and Engineering
  • You provide insights to various stakeholders and streamline analysis and learnings across markets
  • You will set-up and analyse A/B tests for new experimental features and business opportunities
  • You initiate deep dive analyses to understand customer behavior, monitor and report relevant KPIs
  • You will always give analytical evidence as to why we do certain things, thereby challenging and contributing to product decisions based on these insights


Who We Are Looking For
  • You have a quantitative degree and belong to the best of your university
  • You have a deep understanding of numbers as well as a very strong business sense
  • First analytics experience gained through internships
  • Google Analytics (Preferably IQ certified)- mastery in other tracking technologies can be used as an alternative (e.g. Adobe, Webtrekk, SnowPlow, Piwik, etc)
  • Demonstrated aptitude and willingness to learn new analytical methods, software applications, and tools

It would be beneficial if you also have the following:
  • Good understanding of web technologies like Javascript, HTML & CSS is a strong plus
  • Knowledge of Google Tag Manager and BigQuery (alternatively strong SQL knowledge)
  • Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


What We Offer
  • Relocation assistance to move to Berlin and visa application support
  • Competitive compensation
  • Significant reduction on our meal kits
  • Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources
  • Sabbatical policy
  • Work in our office located in the heart of Berlin
  • A diverse and vibrant international environment
  • A range of perks (Free in-house crash course in German, compensation for advanced German classes, in-house lecture series and knowledge sharing programme, discounts for our neighboring gym & Urban Sports Club, free weekly yoga classes, summer & winter parties, discount on our HelloFresh GO vending machines)
  • The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase

Are you up for a challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

Gastrofix GmbH, headquartered in Berlin, was founded in 2011, currently employs 140 people and is represented in 7 countries. With over 15,000 licenses sold and a managed annual turnover of 4 billion euros, the iPad cash register system of the same name is one of the most successful in Europe. The cloud-based POS platform for digitizing the hospitality industry is fully offline capable and therefore particularly fail-safe. Thanks to its versatile additional modules such as branch administration, cash book or customer database, it is also suitable for medium-sized and large companies in the restaurant and hotel industry. With Gastrofix, the cash register becomes a digital control centre for efficient operation.
With expertise in different areas our tech team works on newest features and services to satisfy market needs and improve Gastrofix POS and Cloud. Multiple cross functional teams are responsible for technical solutions of high quality. To make sure, that every team meets the goal, we maintain test driven approach across whole tech department. With over 17 represented nationalities within the company, we focus on a steady growth culture.

Find Us On Twitter

We are growing fast and looking for you on a full-time basis for our headquarter in Berlin .

Your job
  • Delight our customers by improving and extending our successful POS App implemented for IOS platform
  • Create new features and improve existing ones in Swift and Objective-C
  • Be part of an excellent multicultural agile software development team
  • Work closely with other teams to build product that meets growing hospitality market
  • Implement automated test software in Swift, Objective-C and Python, and support our ongoing effort in improving our CI/CD workflows

Your profile
  • BSc / MSc in computer science or similar qualification, MSc preferred
  • Strong software development skills in Swift and Objective-C
  • In-depth knowledge of Core Data, Multithreading, Networking, JSON, git
  • Experience in building robust network applications based on RESTful API
  • 4+ years of work experience in iOS software development for production-grade apps
  • Experience of working in agile teams in rather larger scale projects
  • Be familiar with Test-Driven-Development (TDD)
  • Great problem solving skills
  • Interested in new technologies, looking beyond iOS platform
  • Good conceptual understanding of software design and code beauty
  • Enjoying working and communicating in a team
  • Experience working with git version control
  • Solid English skills

Optional Skills And Experience
  • Have strong technical skills
  • Experience in other programming languages
  • Fundamental IP network knowledge
  • Be familiar with continuous integration and delivery
  • Up-to-date with modern software development

What We Are Offering
  • Flat hierarchies, flexible working hours and agile working atmosphere
  • Competitive and attractive salary
  • Paid relocation: flight and 6 weeks accommodation (if needed)
  • Support with VISA, work permit, bank account and insurance
  • Occasional home office opportunity
  • MacBook Pro and a 27” screen and everything else you need to get the job done
  • Different language courses in the office
  • Nice office in the heart of Berlin near Alexanderplatz train station
  • Goal oriented working style with great amount of flexibility and freedom
  • Great coffee, free drinks, müsli and fruits

How To Apply

Please send us your CV with your salary expectations and earliest possible start date via online form.

Lingokids mission is to break down language barriers and provide equal opportunities for kids all around the world. In order to help us on this mission and continue building a superb user experience for both kids and parents, we’re looking for an exceptional React OR React Native Developer that will be joining our HQ located in sunny Spain.


The company

We’re reinventing early childhood education through an online language learning service for kids. With fresh content - games, books, videos, interactive episodes, etc - every week, we are helping more than 11M families and their children around the world learn English in a fun and effective way. Our dream is to have a positive impact on 100M families and we’re working hard to make it a reality. Our talented team of product designers, software engineers, and content producers tweak and improve our product daily, while incorporating feedback from our customers.


The position


As a React Native Engineer you will be responsible for designing, writing and testing clean code that helps our product reach more than 11M families around the world.

 

You will also get to work on:

  • Work alongside the UX/UI team, the Backend Engineering team, and Product Managers to iterate on new features

  • Designing, writing and testing code using design patterns

  • Diagnose and fix bugs. Address bottlenecks to deliver performance that feels fully native

  • Reach out to the open source community. React Native moves fast and can break things, stay plugged into the state of the art

Capmo writes software for the construction industry. There are 10 million construction workers in Europe alone - and globally construction was a 14 trillion industry last year. 1 out of 10 people in the world eats, sleeps and breath construction every day. We beliefe that the hardest working people in the world also deserve great software to do their jobs. No matter if it is to renovate an apartment or to build a new hospital- We want to help realize great projects to create better environments!

We offer architects and engineers an intuitive SaaS tool to automize repetitive and error-prone tasks in their daily work. Capmo plays a crucial role on thousands of construction sites and is already growing beyond Germany. To continue our rapid growth, we recently closed a seed financing of 2 million euros with UVC Partners and HW Capital.

YOUR TASKS
As React Native developer (m/f/d) you take an active role in shaping our great Android and iOS apps. You will work in an effective, autonomous and feature-based team, where you get the chance to improve your mobile developer skills. If you are passionate about working on a product impacting thousands of construction projects every day, strive to build high-quality software and like to work in an agile and interdisciplinary team, this is the place for you!

About The Project

Mission

To enable truly decentralized identity.

Why

In order to create a truly decentralized world we need sovereign money AND a sovereign identity system. Cryptocurrencies are providing the first piece. The second is still missing.

How

Creating a decentralized identity system is a hard problem. The difficulty lies in introducing scarcity without sacrificing privacy and/or self-sovereignty. We refer to this problem as Decentralized Identity Trilemma . We believe that this problem can be solved by mapping how influence flows in groups of people by tracking attention flows .

What

We are designing an algorithm that can tell who is influential in a group.

About The Product

Hive.one plays a critical role in our overall strategy. In order to deploy the algorithm we need to first demonstrate how useful it can be. That’s what hive.one is for, focusing at the crypto community as a starting point.

It has the important function of creating a demand and giving users the ability to provide us with more data so that we can index their profiles more accurately. As such, hive.one is a means to the goal, but making it successful is essential to the company’s success.

About The Role

Your objective is going to be to make hive.one more useful. As it is becoming more useful it will start naturally filling out the space that LinkedIn has let out - providing an overview of “who is who” in the industry. It seems that LinkedIn has been mismanaged by the current leadership to the degree that it makes for an easy target. We believe that hive.one has a good chance of taking away the market from this platform. By making the product more useful, you will naturally drive it in this direction.

You will be working closely with Dev Lead and UX Lead to make sure they know what needs to get built and why. You will also work closely with the CEO to ensure that what is being built aligns with the broader strategy.

Responsibilities
  • Leadership: Communicate a compelling narrative about your product (and each existing/potential feature): what problem it solves, for whom, how and why solving this problem matters in the first place.
  • Impact Focus: Own key goals and prioritize outcomes and fast learning cycles. Ruthlessly prioritize and keep the team focused on the goals.
  • Zoom in and out: There are no tiny features when you’re doing things properly. Understand how deep or wide you need to go. Break down complex initiative into a manageable chunk of work for your team.
  • User interviews: Making sure we understand why our users choose to use our product, how they use it and how it can be made more useful to them
  • External communication; Communicating new product releases, product vision and mission to our users and relevant groups (e.g. Bitcoin community cluster)
  • Relationship building: Maintaining relationship with key members of the community that’s emerging around our product and with key members of groups that are important stakeholders (e.g. BTC or ETH community clusters)
Your Profile
  • You shipped product, more than once, and have experience working in product growth, engagement, or monetization
  • You are familiar with agile and lean software development frameworks and have used them before
  • You have a solid technical understanding of frontend and backend frameworks
  • You make data-informed decisions from A/B experiments, analytical data, and qualitative research
  • You understand product funnels and select the right metrics to monitor and move
  • You are very familiar with cryptocurrencies and the communities around, I.e. what is often referred to as “Bitcoin community”, “Ethereum community”, “Crypto” or “the crypto ecosystem”. You’ve owned and used cryptocurrencies and you know people who are members of these communities. You should have a good grasp of the lingo and memes that exist within these groups (e.g. “HODL”, “BUIDL” etc.)
  • You use Twitter, Reddit, GitHub, podcasts, Digg, 4Chan, Mastodon etc and understands what makes them successful and where they come up short. You are eager to try new platforms and are quick to learn them.
  • The prospect of immersing yourself for months into them to get a deep understanding of their inner workings is exciting to you. If this is not the case, or even if it's a daunting prospect, you’re not going to have a good time in this role and it’s probably not a fit.
Culture of Critical Thinking

One of the biggest risks we face is that we can fool ourselves into believing that we got something to work when we in fact did not. This is because verifying accuracy of our algorithm’s output takes a long time and significant infrastructure. This means that an experiment that was not well-thought through enough can lead us to wasting months of work. We cannot afford that. For this reason, it is essential that we build a culture around critical thinking and closely follow the Scientific Method.

If You Are Not Familiar With Critical Thinking & The Scientific Method, We Encourage You To Watch The Following Videos Before Having a Chat With Us

 Big no-no’s

Calls to authority (“I’ve been doing this for 20 years and you’re just an intern...”; “the world’s top experts agree that…”, “scientists agree that…”)

Discrediting ideas based on their public perception (“If you think that you are an X, Y, Z”)

Instead of writing a cover letter, please answer the following questions :
  • Imagine that you are talking to an outsider of the “crypto world”. How would you explain to them what hive.one is and what utility it provides to its users?
  • What should we be doing more of and less of?
  • Your objective is to make the product more useful; we define this by more people using our scores as a reference point or people doing so more often. Given the objective, how would you utilize a team of 3 devs over 3 months to drive this usage up?
  • The same question, but now you have the dev team available for 1 day (8 working hours).
  • What strategy or processes would you employ (outside of user interviews) to really understand the diversity and goals of our current user base or future categories of users?
  • You’ve created a rock solid product roadmap and a plan for execution. Everyone has bought in. One day someone (CEO, developer, etc) brings a new feature idea to you that they want moved to the front of the line. How do you handle this?
  • One of the engineers on your team doesn’t seem to be moving at the pace you want. What do you do?

DESCRIPTION

▼ Our mission

We are always looking for new challenges to help us fulfill our mission to create value in a global marketplace where anyone can buy & sell.

The world is full of objects and services being produced and sold, but many of them are thrown away without people realizing that they might be valuable to someone else, wasting valuable natural resources. To contribute towards eliminating waste, we have launched Mercari, a marketplace where people can buy and sell easily and safely, in Japan and the United States.

▼ Our three values (Go Bold, All for One, Be a Pro)

We work together to create a global marketplace, but the road to this goal is by no means easy. In order for us to make new innovations and take on new challenges that no one has taken before, all of us take ownership of our work and make use of our knowledge so that we can create the best product possible as one team. To achieve this, we all take action based on our three company values (Go Bold, All for One, and Be a Pro).

▼ The goal of the engineering organization

At Mercari, engineering teams always strive to continuously produce significant results. To do this, our organization constantly welcomes changes and new challenges, cooperates and co-creates, is diverse, offers freedom, and encourages all of us to take ownership and make our own decisions. We want to continue taking on new challenges, working together as one team, going bold, and taking ownership so that we can grow individually, while working toward the realization of Mercari’s mission.

Our team mission is to improve software engineering productivity across the company.

Currently Mercari’s Japan based productivity team is building and designing a world class experimentation and feature flagging platform. We are looking for skilled developers to help build and maintain our new experimentation platform.

listings.position: Data Professional (data scientist, data engineer, data analist)
listings.description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Yacht specializes in human resource for temporary and permanent jobs with the top 30 companies in the Netherlands.
Functieomschrijving

Join the leading companies in IT

Are you looking for a new challenge? Have you ever thought about the Netherlands as your next career destination? Come to one of the most innovative countries in the world, where you will experience a great living and working environment. Join our community of Data professionals and team at Yacht and be part of Mostdata.

MostData community
MostData is the Yacht Community by and for Data professionals. We are constantly looking for the most challenging positions at our clients so that you can work on meaningful and technically advanced data projects. Amongst our clients are ING, ABN AMRO, Rabobank (the 3 largest banks in the Netherlands), eBay, VodafoneZiggo, KPN, Liberty Global, Philips, and many more interesting tech companies. We invest in improving your skills through a tailor-made education program. At our Yacht Academy, you will be offered various possibilities to gain and share knowledge through training, workshops and tech talks. And we organize events such as meetups, VR zombie shootings (which is quite fun actually) and bbq’s, to chill out and have a good time together.

Yacht is one of the leading HR companies in the Netherlands. Our mother company Randstad Holding is the leading HR company in the world. For our MostData community, we focus on data analysts, data scientists and data engineers. Our MostDev community has a focus on development positions for front-end, back-end, and full developers. Want to know more? Watch this video about the Most Dev community: https://youtu.be/VttLo1rjhCM

About You

You have a great interest in data analysis, data engineering or data science. Both during and outside office hours you are always looking for opportunities to develop yourself. You know how to make the next step and go from looking in the past to predicting the future! To do this you are working with the latest technologies such as Hadoop, Kafka, Splunk, Python, R, Hive, Matlab, SAS, Ruby or Perl. You are also making your way into Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Elasticsearch. Nex, to that you have experience with Cloud platforms such as Google, AWS or Azure.

Working in the Netherlands
When you have decided that Yacht is going to be your next employer, we are going to help you relocate. We have a special department to support you: the Expat Center. They will take care of applying for your visa, help you find housing and book your flight. We will even pay for your flight, your first month of rent and for the visa application. That is how we ensure that your arrival in the Netherlands goes as smoothly as possible.

What does that look like? Watch this video: https://youtu.be/U_UzTZMuDu0
Functie-eisen

This Is What We Expect From You
  • Degree in Computer Science / IT
  • 5+ years of experience in development
  • Professional experience with the newest technologies
  • Speaking English fluently and having great communication skills
  • Being flexible in working for different clients
Arbeidsvoorwaarden

What do you get in return?
  • One of the coolest communities to work with
  • A salary, depending on your work experience
  • Your own budget for education purposes
  • A single person who guides you
  • Help with relocating and applying for visa
Sollicitatieprocedure

Voor meer informatie neem je contact op met Joey Winter via telefoonnummer 06-10351769

Werken voor Yacht
Yacht is dé organisatie van en voor professionals. Wij verbinden professionals en organisaties die het verschil willen maken. Ons doel is optimaal resultaat: jou als professional uitdagend werk bieden waarmee jij de organisaties van onze opdrachtgevers blijvend verbetert. Behoor jij tot de beste professionals in jouw vak? Wil je samen met vakgenoten het verschil maken bij toonaangevende organisaties? Dan willen we jou graag leren kennen.

listings.position: Manager/Senior Manager - Global Risk, Banking, & Compliance
listings.description:
American Express invites you to share your resume so you can be considered for future Manager/Senior Manager opportunities in the New York, Phoenix, Salt Lake City, and Sunrise locations within our Global Risk, Banking & Compliance Organization (GRBC).

There Are Several Exciting Analyst And Manager Opportunities Across GRBC In The Following Areas

At American Express we are passionate about our commitment to driving growth and progress by creating a culture of awareness and proactivity around regulatory matters to ensure we deliver maximum value to our shareholders and our customers efficiently and effectively. The Global Risk, Banking & Compliance Organization (GRBC) ensures the company operates in a safe, sound and fully compliant manner within all applicable regulatory expectations.

Global Operational Risk & Oversight Organization (GORO) is responsible for managing the various risks AXP faces through continuous monitoring, reviews and testing processes. This team strengthens AXP’s risk management practices through the latest advances in data science and technology, staying apprised of changing regulatory landscape, and monitoring emerging risks across the industry. This team is responsible for overseeing Enterprise, Operational, Credit, Market, and Model Risk across the company and provides regular updates to the AXP Chief Risk Officer.

Global Compliance & Ethics (GCE) maintains and continually enhances a comprehensive and highly effective compliance program across the company. Compliance colleagues play a critical role in protecting the Company, our brand and colleagues through practical, solution-focused guidance on regulatory and ethics-related matters. A team of compliance officers work closely with the General Counsel's Office, business units, staff groups, and risk professionals across the company to provide standards and guidance in the development, implementation and maintenance of comprehensive compliance programs and to promote a strong risk management culture.

Global Regulatory Affairs (GRA) consists of International Banking, Exam Management, and Regulatory Relations. The team builds strong partnerships with US and international regulators, drives operational excellence in the handling of examinations and all regulatory interactions, and helps to formulate an accurate and appropriate position for the company in connection with matters under regulatory review.

The Privacy & Information Risk Management team is responsible for overseeing the risks related Global Privacy, Information Security, Records Management, Data Deletion and Information Technology. The team focus on driving and maintaining trust in the American Express brand through the creation of independent risk frameworks, policies and practices that ultimately protect our customers’ personal information while driving transparency and fairness in how the Company uses data

Qualifications
  • Demonstrated experience building, sustaining and leveraging relationships
  • Track record of effective communication and presentations to multiple stakeholders, senior management and executives.
  • Strong work ethic, organizational skills and attention to detail with excellent follow-up skills
  • Demonstrated willingness to take initiative and act decisively
  • Ability to think strategically and influence teammates on multiple, cross-functional teams
  • Project management skills with the ability to prioritize and multitask
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to organize, manage, analyze, and interpret large amounts of data to identify trends and themes
  • Proven ability to translate highly technical and complex information into easily understandable terms
  • Superior Microsoft Office skills with emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint

Preferred Additional
  • Understanding and knowledge of bank laws and regulations, relevant compliance requirements, U.S. Bank systems and processes as well as legal contracts and related governance activities a plus.
  • Knowledge of relevant regulatory compliance requirements, preferably at a regulated financial institution and / or consumer products and AML/ Anti-Corruption/BSA.
  • Commercial real estate or commercial underwriting background, experience in CRA investment vehicles or a Community Development Finance Certification.
  • Experience with audit, compliance, risk, regulatory management, marketing and product management, finance, technologies or control related functions is a plus
  • Good knowledge of the framework of risk management and financial credit products and assets
  • SAS, SQL, skills a plus
  • Familiarity with statistical/analytical software packages.
  • Experience with Archer/SIQ also a plus.

About Us

American Express’ heritage was built on service and has been sustained by innovation. Through our evolution from an express mail business in 1850, to one of the world’s largest card issuers by purchasing volume and a digital innovator, we’ve never been afraid to explore new possibilities and embrace the changing marketplace.

From our high employee Satisfaction ratings to our many workplace awards, American Express is consistently recognized as a great place to work by people around the world. We offer talented individuals challenging work with purpose by embracing both innovation and tradition. As our company has grown and evolved, sometimes reinventing our business outright, we have never strayed from the customer-service ethos and values on which the company was built –trust, security, integrity, quality, good citizenship, respect and customer commitment.

Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.

Click here to view the "EEO is the Law" poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

Gastrofix GmbH, headquartered in Berlin, was founded in 2011, currently employs 140 people and is represented in 7 countries. With Gastrofix, the cash register becomes a digital control centre for efficient operation.
With expertise in different areas our tech team works on newest features and services to satisfy market needs and improve Gastrofix POS and Cloud. A few of the responsibilities include supporting feasibility studies, applying modern data storage techniques, discovering explanatory features in high-dimensionality collections of data, exploring data using scientifically valid techniques to applying a modern software or analytic development lifecycle methodology.

Basic Qualifications

listings.position: Sr / Lead Software Engineer ( C++ / Machine- / Motion Control) | Eindhoven
listings.description:
We are Trinamics, a recruitment agency specialized in technical vacancies. We support our candidates in finding the right position at one of our clients in the Netherlands. We recruit both candidates from the Netherlands as well as the rest of the world. One of the reasons our employees choose to work via Trinamics is because of our personal approach throughout the whole recruitment process. But we do not stop there, you will have the same contact person your whole career at Trinamics supporting you any way they can. Next to this we always strive to make the best match possible, both on a technical as well as a personal level.
If you would like to join Trinamics, but you are currently living abroad, we will naturally help you with the administrative, VISA, 30% and moving process.

Introduction
We are looking for a Senior or Lead Software Engineer to join one of our clients. Do you feel comfortable in a multicultural, high-tech environment? Would you like to develop software in a multidisciplinary group of people (Mechatronics, Electronics, Mechanics and of course Software)? Than we might be looking for you!

Role Description

As a senior / lead software engineer you will get the chance to have an impact on the worldwide semiconductor industry.
With your broad software experience you will get the chance to have a very diverse role within the software team. You will be responsible for the software architecture and implementation, but also for the testing, integration and partly maintenance of very complex machines. Within the team it is appreciated that you have a proactive attitude. For example you see it as a challenge to explore new tools and techniques to improve the software development process. Next to this we ask you to coach your junior colleagues in their development.
The size of the software team that you will join is between 10 and 20 people. Your colleagues are used to applying the Agile Scrum methodology on a daily basis in their work.

Functie-eisen

On a technical level
We are looking for a senior candidate (around 10 or more years of experience).
The code base that our client uses is mainly based on C and C++, so we are looking for a candidate with broad experience in these languages. It helps if you also have some experience with Python or C#.
The machines that you will get to develop software for have a lot of moving part at very high speed on a nanometer precision scale. So we are looking for you if you have experience with developing realtime software for moving part in a complex environment. Some different examples of this could be: you developed software for safety critical systems in the aerospace industry; you developed software for complex washing machines or you have developed machine control software.
It is an advantages if you have experience with Agile software development, continuous integration and model driven design.

On a personal level
For this position it is important that you feel comfortable communicating on different levels within the organization. On one hand you will coach your junior colleagues, on the other hand it could be your responsibility to give some pushback on an architectural decision of a senior colleague.
Keeping the software of high quality is important to you. If you have ideas on how to improve the software (process) you are it comes naturally to you to bring them forward within the organization.

5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55

Lead Data Engineer - Berlin - up to 100.000 p.a.

A well-funded Fintech company based in Europe's No. 1 tech hub; Berlin is looking for a Team lead engineer to join their team.The innovative Startup, which raised nearly 50 million in the timeframe of only 2 years is involved in software and mobile development of systems supporting the German tax declaration and tax refund processes.
